Story Factors *Xenophobia/Obedience: Crooloyans believe themselves to be the crown of creation. They won't obey non-crooloyan leaders and laws, but will follow even the most moronic command of a superior crooloyan. Gamemaster Notes *I use Menotrop for whatever I adapt, change or convert to Star Wars D6. Menotrop also makes a great villain. If you need a greedy corporation, that does not know any morale - here it is! Appearance and Biology: Crooloyans are basically broad-shouldered, muscular snakemen with long snouts and small, black eyes. Roughly a third of their bodies is made up by humanoid upper torsos, with muscular arms, ending in dexterous hands with black claws, that are unsuitable for fighting, because they would break off, but perfect tools for fine mechanical work. Many crooloyans will have an individual pattern, of which claws they grow out and which they keep short, depending on their occupation. The rest is a long, tail, on which they "sit" most of the time. They never stop growing and old individuals (200+ years) can reach sizes of up to 3 meters and even more. Their skin color ranges from pale yellow (Siha) in Crooloy's deserts to deep green (Talha), brown (Braha) and blue (Nalha) in the jungles and near big bodies of water. Albino crooloyans are seen as gifts from the gods and many of them, if not all take on careers as priests, corporate execs and military leaders. The planet is ruled by the Nalhada, which translates into "white-blue". Crooloyans are cold blooded reptiles, who need a warm, humid climate to maintain their health. This is the number one reason for their low traveling ambitions. The Siha are the only exception, because they have adapted to the dry climate and the cold nights of the desert. Crooloyans lay 6-12 eggs, of which about 50% breed to hatchlings, that have a one out of three survival rating. Nalhada eggs are black and once discovered they are taken care of by the crooloyan government. History and Culture: The Crooloyans sprang from jungle inhabiting lizards and began creating art and language around 400,000 years ago. The oldest surviving site built on crooloy are the holy temples of Nahha, which are around 50,000 years old. The crooloyans are masterful technicians and it is believed, that they almost wiped out their entire species in a series of planet spanning wars. No documents exists, that could prove this assumption, though. It is more a myth trying to explain the incredible hive-mindedness of the reptilian species. After the invention of hyperspace drives, they had a brief period of exploration and adventuring, but their bodies relied on their hot jungles too much to have sucess as a colonizing species. The crooloyans quickly began to enjoy plan b: The Menotrop Corporation, which was the only survivor of the so-called Corporate War Era spilled its goods on the interstellar market and soon became a major player in the sector. The cold reptilian intellects combined with the technological competence displayed by the crooloyans paved the way to success. Menotrop never got a firm hold on the markets of the core or the colonies, because of the long-established corporations, that controlled these territories and the crooloyans' inability to adapt to human taste. Instead they became a successful supplier of ugly but extremely durable and reliable machinery and a major player in mining. Crooloy was a part of the Confederation of Independent Systems, but quickly fell in line with the new order, supplying components to such wonderful creations as the Star Destroyer, the Death Star or the Orbital Missile Platform. They were equally quick to strike deals with the Hutts and New Republic when the Empire's grip crumbled. The planet, the military and the state-owned Menotrop Corporation is ruled by a council of albino senators and a high queen. This is in effect since the mythological conflict known as the crowning war or the uniting war. Technology Level: The crooloyans have invented their own hyperdrive technology about 14,000 years ago. Temperament: Crooloyans almost never show emotions - for good and for bad. If a crooloyan is driven into an extreme condition, they usually don't know how to deal with it. While nobody would be bothered by a crooloyan who apparently ignores the victory celebrations around him, an angry crooloyan shows dangerously erratic behavior, often acting like a spoiled brat or even showing random violence. Trade and Technology: The Menotrop Corporation is Crooloy's last and only corporation.The produce EVERYTHING for the planetary market and some of their goods became galactic successes. Menotrop cargo and mining ships - heavily armed and armored despite their intended commercial purpose - are popular in the dangerous, pirate infested regions outside the reach of the republican/imperial forces, Menotrop starfighters - huge and expensive; almost crossbreeds with attack transports, easily replacing three weaker ships - are popular among security forces and bounty hunters who need a lot of fire power in a fast and maneuverable ship. They make very durable and highly reliable blasters, machine components, armor suits, speeders and much more, but it all can be described as unsymmetrical, alien and with the color of clotted blood. Notes: *I don't know if these guys make an interesting player species, but they are the mind and the body of the Menotrop Corporation. Suggested Skills: *Most crooloyans make use of their edge in technology.

races.name: Crystal Clone
races.introText: Crystal Clones Size: Dependent on the person being cloned Move: Dependent on the person being cloned Homeworld: Foglo Source: Richard Greenleaf Special Abilities *Enhanced Sight: Because Crystal Clones retain some of the cloning crystal within them, their vision is better than the being they are cloned from. This results in a +1D+2 bonus to all Perception attribute or Search skill checks. *Enhanced Stamina: Because Crystal Clones retain some of the cloning crystal within them, a Crystal Clone can push themselves further than most beings can. This results in a +2D bonus to all Stamina checks. However, the crystal within them is also fragile and can have a reverse effect if the Crystal Clone is wounded. When wounded, a Crystal Clone suffers a -2D penalty to all Stamina checks while still wounded. For each level above wounded status, subtract an extra 1D. *Resist Stun: The cloning crystals of Foglo have the ability to absorb stun blasts. Because Crystal Clones retain some of the cloning crystal within them, this natural ability of the cloning crystals gives the clones a natural ability to resist being stunned. Roll 4D versus the stun damage roll. If the results are equal to/or higher than the stun damage roll, the clone resists being stunned. *Sense Cloning: Every twenty years of a Crystal Clone's life, they can sense the imminent cloning of the being from which they have been cloned. Such senses usually draw the Crystal Clone to the cloning crystal from which they originated so as to be able to take care of the new born clones and raise them. However, a Crystal Clone may attempt to resist such urges by making a successful Difficult Willpower roll. The greater they miss the roll by, the stronger the urge becomes until they must give up everything their doing to go and wait by the crystal until the new clones arrive. The first time they miss the Willpower roll, they must wait three days before they can a make another Willpower roll. If they miss four Willpower rolls in a row, then each time this happens add an addition three days for each time they miss. Yet if they make a successful Willpower roll, then they do not have to make another for ten days. However, successfully resisting the urge is also dangerous as their is a 1D chance that they will be driven mad by the urge. If the results are one or six, then the clone is driven mad. The madness lasts for 3D days for every four points by which they go over the Willpower roll. For example, four to seven points above results in being mad for 3D days, eight to eleven result in being mad for 6D days, etc. If they roll the Willpower roll exactly, or roll three points above it, and then roll a one or six to determine if resisting drives them made, then they suffer from madness for three days. Story Factors *Recognition: Because Crystal Clones are clones, there is always the chance that a particular clone from a certain line will be recognized but someone they have never met. This could result in them being viewed as a twin to another Crystal Clone from the same line, the child or grandchild of an older Crystal Clone from the same line, or even as being immortal. However, most likely being recognized will mean problems for a Crystal Clone. Someone looking for another member of the Crystal Clone's line to kill them, arrest them, or something else could easily mistake a Crystal Clone they have never met for the one they are after. If they had killed another member of the clone's line and see a different member of that line walking around, they could attempt to kill them to make sure their dead. Or the appearance of a different Crystal Clone from the same line could inspire fear of the dead rising from the grave in an individual or a local populace. *Sense Cloning: Even if a Crystal Clone is taken from Foglo just after their birth and have no idea of the planet, every twenty years they begin dreaming about the planet. In particular the area where the cloning crystal that created them is located. These herald the imminent cloning of clones from the same being the crystal Clone was cloned from and begin two months before the cloning occurs. The dreams create an urge within the Crystal Clone to return to the cloning crystal from which they came. This urge may become so great that the Crystal Clone may ignore everything else to return to where they were born. Upon arrival at the cloning crystal, they remain near the cloning crystal until the new crystal clones are created. Once the new crystal clones are created, they take one of the infants and either raise them themselves or find a home for them. Appearance and Biology A Crystal Clone's appearance is dependent on the appearance of the being they are cloned from and the clone's gender. Because Crystal Clones can be the opposite gender of the being they are cloned from, their appearance may be slightly more masculine or feminine when they are the opposite gender. That is, if the cloned being is male and the crystal clone is female, then she will look slightly more masculine than feminine. If the cloned being is male and the clone is male, then the clone will look like him at the various stages of his life as they age. If the clone grows older than the person being cloned, then one will get an idea of what that person would have looked like. Also, Crystal Clones will never develop the scars of the being's they are cloned from unless they receive those same scars themselves. Because Crystal Clones look exactly like members of the species from which the being they are cloned belongs to, the only way to determine if they are actually Crystal Clones is to look into their eyes. In the corners of their eye are flakes of the cloning crystal that created the Crystal Clone. These flakes may be green, blue, red, or yellow and appear to in the shape of an octagon. Temperament Generally, a Crystal Clone's temperament remains fairly close to the temperament of the being from whom they are cloned from. However, it is not uncommon for a Crystal Clone's temperament to be drastically different. If the cloned being is typically violent, then it is possible that one or more of their Crystal Clones could be just the opposite.

races.name: Cyborrean
races.introText: Cyborrean The Cyborreans were the native sentient species of the planet Cyborrea in Hutt Space. They were almost always at war with each other, and were a client species of the Hutts. When not engaged in battle, they hunted the vicious creatures of their planet to keep their skills sharp. They were known for breeding Cyborrean Battle Dogs, vicious, dog-sized creatures that were fitted with armor and cyborg implants. They were often sold on the black market. Attribute Dice: 12D DEXTERITY 2D/4D KNOWLEDGE 2D/4D MECHANICAL 2D/4D PERCEPTION 2D/4D STRENGTH 2D/4D TECHNICAL 2D/4D Special Abilities: * None Listed Move: 10/12 Size: 1.5-2.0 meters tall
